instructions: Open the App Switcher using one of the following methods: On an iPhone with Face ID: Drag one finger up from the bottom edge of the screen until you feel the second vibration or hear three tones, then lift your finger. On an iPhone with a Home button: Double-click the Home button. To browse the open apps, swipe left or right until the app you want is selected. Double-tap to open the app.
Tap the status bar at the top of the screen. Swipe left or right to hear the time, battery state, Wi-Fi signal strength, and more.
Tap anywhere on the Home screen outside the status bar. Swipe down with three fingers.

Connect iPhone and your computer using USB . Do one of the following: In the Finder sidebar on your Mac: Select your iPhone, click General at the top of the window, then click Restore iPhone. Note: To use the Finder to restore iPhone to factory settings, macOS Catalina is required. With earlier versions of macOS, use iTunes to restore iPhone. In the iTunes app on a Windows PC: Click the iPhone button near the top left of the iTunes window, click Summary, then click Restore iPhone. Follow the onscreen instructions.
